para.text: In addition to the functions authorized under § 3-1206.04, a certified clinical nurse specialist may provide the services described in subsection (b) of this section related to specific specialties, including:
Populations, such as pediatrics, geriatrics, or women's health;
Settings, such as critical care or the emergency room;
Diseases or medical subspecialties, such as diabetes or oncology;
Types of care, such as psychiatric or rehabilitation; and
Types of problem, such as pain, wounds, and stress.
A clinical nurse specialist may provide diagnosis, treatment, and ongoing management of patients or clients, through:
Providing for the continuous improvement of patient or client outcomes and nursing care;
Practicing within the core competencies and behaviors specified by the National Association of Clinical Nurse Specialists or other national certifying body recognized by the Board;
Creating therapeutic environments through mentoring and system changes;
Practicing with individual clients, families, groups, and populations of clients; and
Any other functions and roles prescribed by rules.
